name: Tobias Dumschat
title: B. Sc.
cv: Tobias Dumschat is a student research assistant since October 2018 funded by the Volkswagen Foundation (research group „Society after Money – Simulation“). He is enrolled in the Business Master‘s program of RWTH Aachen University. After presenting his Bachelor thesis titled "The Ethical Influence of Different Ways of Communication" at Cologne University in 2017, supervised by Prof. Dr. Bernd Irlenbusch, he now focuses his studies on "Sustainability and Corporations". Before studying, he has successfully absolved a vocational training in Merchant for Forwarding and Logistics services at DB Schenker AG in Düsseldorf. Towards the end of his Bachelor's program, he has been employed as student assistant at several business orientated companies (Einstieg GmbH, REWE Group) as well as the Chair for History of Business, Society and Technology of RWTh Aachen University, held by Prof. Dr. Paul Thomes.
